title: Newton JV loses
text:
Published: Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015 10:55 a.m. CDT • Updated: Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015 10:57 a.m. CDT By Jocelyn Sheets Newton Daily News 
Trailing 14-0, Newton High’s Reagan Maple found Austin Reynolds for a 13-yard touchdown pass play with 22 seconds left in the third quarter Monday against visiting Pella. Pella blocked the extra point. 
The Cardinal junior varsity football team lost 14-6 to the Little Dutch at H.A. Lynn Stadium. 
Pella scored on the first play of the second quarter and led 8-0 at halftime. Newton’s Zach Combs attempted a 27-yard field goal in the first half but the kick went wide of the mark. 
Newton had four turnovers in the game which hampered the offensive output. 
Jaron Roush was the leading rusher, 10 carries for 54 yards, and leading receiver, two catches for 64 yards. Matt Karsten had 38 yards on four carries before he left the game with an injury. Maple went 4-of-8 passing for 97 yards with a touchdown and an interception. 
Leading the Newton defense were Grant Garvis, Combs and Joe Busch. 
Newton hosts a 6 p.m. game Monday against Bondurant-Fararr.
